title: Download ILSA files
text: Currently ILSAmerge able download several ILSA datasets, including: ‘PISA’, ‘TALIS’, ‘TIMSS’, ‘TIMSS Advanced’, ‘PIRLS’, ‘ICCS’, ‘ICILS’, ‘CIVED’, ‘REDS’, ‘RLII’, ‘SITES.’ links datasets allocated GitHub, links can corrected . availableILSA(), can check datasets available:

what: Download the datasets for a particular study
title: Download ILSA files
text: Depending study datasets uploaded 1 .zip files. ILSAdownload() handle many .zip files download. example, let us say want download data ‘RLII’ 1991. , least need opt three arguments; study, year, outputdir: can see, studies require agree license agreements. case, required answer agree . order continue, need agree. know agree study terms, can also avoid prompt via agreeLicense = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir()) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## License Agreement downloaded. ## Do you agree with these terms and conditions? ## Please answer TRUE or FALSE. ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              agreeLicense = TRUE) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## 1 files found for RLII 1991. ## Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: Download ILSA files
text: function can also unzip downloaded files using unzip = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              unzip = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: possible avoid printing quiet = TRUE, still prompted agree. avoid prints can use arguments:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              quiet = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: Timeout times downloading controlled maxtime, can set desired number seconds:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              maxtime = 60)

title: Load ILSA files
text: Using ILSAfile.info() can identify different populations within ILSA. Moreover, can also use information loading specific population memory. Using ‘REDS’ 2021 example data provided package:
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")) ##   Population Files  MB ## 1      BCGV1     4 0.3 ## 2      BSGV1     4 0.4 ## 3      BTGV1     4 0.3

title: Load ILSA files
text: can decide load population, like BCGV1, using justload(): result list elements loaded haven, example, list 11 elements:
code: loaded <- justload(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),          population = "BCGV1") class(loaded) ## [1] "list"  length(loaded) ## [1] 4  loaded[[1]] ## # A tibble: 10 × 314 ##    IDCNTRY             IDSCHOOL ITLANGC      IP1G00A   IP1G00B      IP1G00C      ##    <dbl+lbl>           <dbl+lb> <dbl+lbl>    <dbl+lbl> <dbl+lbl>    <dbl+lbl>    ##  1 784 [United Arab E… 1001     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   3 [March]    9 (NA) [Omi… ##  2 784 [United Arab E… 1002     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  3 784 [United Arab E… 1003     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  4 784 [United Arab E… 1004      1 [English] 3 [Late]  2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  5 784 [United Arab E… 1005     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    3 [Late]     ##  6 784 [United Arab E… 1006     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   2 [February] 2 [Mid]      ##  7 784 [United Arab E… 1007     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    3 [Late]     ##  8 784 [United Arab E… 1008     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    2 [Mid]      ##  9 784 [United Arab E… 1009     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   3 [March]    1 [Early]    ## 10 784 [United Arab E… 1010     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   6 [June]     3 [Late]     ## # ℹ 308 more variables: IP1G00D <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAA <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAD <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAE <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAF <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAG <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBA <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBB <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIBC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBD <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01B <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01C1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C2 <dbl+lbl>, IP2G01A1 <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01AA <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02B <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G02C <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02D <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02E <dbl+lbl>, …

title: Load ILSA files
text: purposes, might need load column information, probably check attributes correct. can setting justattributes = TRUE: load 11 datasets 0 rows :
code: loaded <- justload(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),          population = "BCGV1", justattributes = TRUE) length(loaded) ## [1] 4  loaded[[1]] ## # A tibble: 0 × 314 ## # ℹ 314 variables: IDCNTRY <dbl+lbl>, IDSCHOOL <dbl+lbl>, ITLANGC <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G00A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00B <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00C <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00D <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAA <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAD <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAE <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAF <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAG <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBA <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIBB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBD <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01A <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01B <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C2 <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP2G01A1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01AA <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02A <dbl+lbl>, …

title: Merge ILSA files
text: example, can use data ‘REDS’ 2021 provided package. case ‘REDS’ 2021, 12 files 3 populations: ILSAmerge() can combine files number populations . default type “rds”, also can make “zsav” “sav” files:
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")) ##   Population Files  MB ## 1      BCGV1     4 0.3 ## 2      BSGV1     4 0.4 ## 3      BTGV1     4 0.3 ILSAmerge(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),            outputdir = tempdir(),            filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"))

title: Merge ILSA files
text: Depending goals capabilities computer, may consider adjusting options ILSAmerge(): population: need merge populations path, include character vector. format output ILSAfile.info(). MBlimit: set NULL, default, files merged within R. set numeric value establish limit (output ILSAfile.info()) files going merged R, populations go limit merged R, instead SPSS syntax produced. Later, can use syntax merge files. MBlistlimit: ILSAmerge() files merged two ways: using list produced lapply function, empty matrix filled subscripts. first method almost always faster, can use lot memory. argument establishes limit merging list matrix. recommend setting higher 200. SPSSlimit: SPSS syntaxes going produced important take account SPSS requirements handling files. vary SPSS version, normally total 50 files per command.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: ILSAmerge() runs, information progress merging running time produced:
code: ILSAmerge(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),            outputdir = tempdir(),            filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav")) ## 12 files detected. Merging into 3 files. ## Merging BCGV1. Type 1 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BCGV1 took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes. ## Merging BSGV1. Type 2 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BSGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. ## Merging BTGV1. Type 3 of 3. ## Merging dataset 1 of 4. ## Merging dataset 2 of 4. ## Merging dataset 3 of 4. ## Merging dataset 4 of 4. ## Merging BTGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. ## Merging took 1 seconds or 0.01 minutes.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: merging countries also possible merge datasets different respondents. Two functions available merge respondents: combineStudents(), addSchools.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: combineStudents() combines multiple student files, e.g., achievement background questionnaires, using ‘TIMSS’ Advanced 1995: can see, new file created combining achievement student questionnaire.
code: # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/timssadv", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path were merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")  # Merging 'TIMSS' Advanced 1995, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = TRUE)  # Rename files ILSArename(output) ## 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) found. ## 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) renamed.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  # Combine student files combineStudents(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) ## 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() student file(s) found. Combining into 1 file(s). ## Combining student 1 of 1. ## Combining students took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"

title: Merge ILSA files
text: addSchools() adds school data student teacher files, using ‘TIMSS’ Advanced 1995: can see, new file created combining information students schools.
code: # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"  # Add school data addSchools(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) ## 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() file(s) found. Adding schools to 1 file(s). ## Combined students found for MSAM1. ## Adding schools to MSAM1, file 1 of 1. ## Adding schools took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") ## [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              ## [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" ## [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"  ## [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"             ## [5] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student&school.rds"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrés Christiansen. Author, maintainer. Andrés Strello. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christiansen (2024). ILSAmerge: Merge Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data. R package version 1.3.1, https://dopatendo.github.io/ILSAmerge/, https://github.com/dopatendo/ILSAmerge.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ILSAmerge: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data},   author = {Andrés Christiansen},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.3.1, https://dopatendo.github.io/ILSAmerge/},   url = {https://github.com/dopatendo/ILSAmerge}, }

what: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: common data International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA), like TIMSS, TIMSS Advanced, PIRLS, ICCS, ICILS, CIVED, REDS, RLII, SITES, come unaggregated format. means data published hundreds files, one represents combination countries participants (students, teachers, principals, etc.) also common researches need merge data include countries single file. goal ILSAmerge make process simple straightforward possible.

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: can install stable version ILSAmerge directly CRAN: , wish install development version ILSAmerge:
code: install.packages("ILSAmerge") remotes::install_github("dopatendo/ILSAmerge")

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: downloading ILSA data, can use ILSAdownload(). example see vignette("Download").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: identifying populations within study, can use ILSAfiles.info(). example see vignette("IndentifyILSAfiles").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: need load ILSA data save , can use justload(). example see vignette("Load").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: merging ILSA data, can use ILSAmerge(). example see vignette("Merge").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: rename ILSA data, can use ILSArename(). example see vignette("Rename").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: can combine steps using ILSAready(). example see vignette("Onestep").

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Downloads 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). functions supports following ILSA: 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES.' Depending study, need decide data download, read accept terms conditions proceed download.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: ILSAdownload(   study,   year,   outputdir = getwd(),   unzip = FALSE,   maxtime = 999,   quiet = FALSE,   agreeLicense = FALSE )

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: study string indicating name study. available studies check description function. year numeric value indicating year study. outputdir directory data downloaded. unzip logical value indicating files unzipped. Default FALSE. maxtime numeric value indicating maximum time allowed downloading file. Default 999. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE. agreeLicense logical value indicating agree Disclaimer License Agreement file www.iea.nl. FALSE, prompted agree else data downloaded. Default FALSE.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Saves 'SPSS' ILSA data locally.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: # For example, to download 'RLII' 1991 data:  # Path where files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAdownload")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAdownload")   # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = output, unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: Aggregates International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) data files information population.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir = getwd())

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: data frame number files MBs per population.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Get file information ILSAfile.info(inputdir = input) #>   Population Files  MB #> 1      BCGV1     4 0.3 #> 2      BSGV1     4 0.4 #> 3      BTGV1     4 0.3

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Merges 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). function tested behave correctly : 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006).

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: ILSAmerge(   inputdir = getwd(),   outputdir = getwd(),   population = NULL,   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   MBlimit = NULL,   MBlistlimit = 200,   SPSSlimit = 50,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. outputdir directory merged data saved. population character vector indicating files merged. NULL (default), files merged. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. filetype string indicating type file saved, can "rds", "zsav", "sav". MBlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type (see ILSAfile.info()). type files go limit, files merged R, 'SPSS' syntax produced via spss.syntax(). set NULL, limit used files merged within R. speed problem, recommend number 200 merge rest 'SPSS'. Beware ILSA files different columns cause 'SPSS' syntaxes fail. happens, merge R. MBlistlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type merging list. Values limit merged matrix, slower uses less memory. Default 200. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Saves merged ILSA data .sps syntax merging ILSA data.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: files merged within R also add country information needed. Country information retrieved 'GitHub' possible. , use package internal data.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAmerge")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"ILSAmerge")  # Merging 'REDS' 2021, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = FALSE) #> 12 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging BCGV1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BCGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging BSGV1. Type 2 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BSGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging BTGV1. Type 3 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BTGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes.

what: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
text: Downloads ILSA data, merges , combines students adds school information. function wrapper ILSAdownload, ILSAmerge, ILSArename, combineStudents, addSchools. see ILSA available function use availableILSA. data already downloaded can use ILSAreadylocal.

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
code: ILSAready(   study,   year,   outputdir = getwd(),   MBlistlimit = 200,   quiet = FALSE,   agreeLicense = FALSE )  ILSAreadylocal(   inputdir = getwd(),   outputdir = getwd(),   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   quiet = FALSE,   MBlistlimit = 200 )

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
text: study string indicating name study. available studies check description function. year numeric value indicating year study. outputdir directory merged data saved. MBlistlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type merging list. Values limit merged matrix, slower uses less memory. Default 200. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE. agreeLicense logical value indicating agree Disclaimer License Agreement file www.iea.nl. FALSE, prompted agree else data downloaded. Default FALSE. inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. filetype string indicating type file saved, can "rds", "zsav", "sav".

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
text: Saves merged renamed ILSA data.

title: Download and prepare ILSA data — ILSAready
code: dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"timssadv"),showWarnings = FALSE) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"timssadv")  input <- system.file("extdata/timssadv", package = "ILSAmerge")  ILSAreadylocal(inputdir = input, outputdir = output) #> 15 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging MCGM1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MCGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSAM1. Type 2 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSAM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSGM1. Type 3 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes. #> 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() student file(s) found. Combining into 1 file(s). #> Combining student 1 of 1. #> Combining students took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() file(s) found. Adding schools to 1 file(s). #> Combined students found for MSAM1. #> Adding schools to MSAM1, file 1 of 1. #> Adding schools took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) found. #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) renamed. #> Preparing data took 1 seconds or 0.01 minutes.

title: Rename ILSAmerge files — ILSArename
text: Renames files produced ILSAmerge name codes comprehensible names including study name, year respondent. function tested behave correctly : 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006).

title: Rename ILSAmerge files — ILSArename
code: ILSArename(   inputdir = getwd(),   codeTOname = TRUE,   overwrite = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Rename ILSAmerge files — ILSArename
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. codeTOname logical value indicating files renamed codes names (TRUE) names codes (FALSE). Default TRUE. overwrite logical value indicating files overwritten. FALSE, files copied new names. Default TRUE. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE.

title: Rename ILSAmerge files — ILSArename
text: Renames copies files produced ILSAmerge.

title: Rename ILSAmerge files — ILSArename
code: # Merge files dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021"),showWarnings = FALSE) ILSAmerge(inputdir = system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge"),  outputdir = file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021")) #> 12 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging BCGV1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BCGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging BSGV1. Type 2 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BSGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging BTGV1. Type 3 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 4. #> Merging dataset 2 of 4. #> Merging dataset 3 of 4. #> Merging dataset 4 of 4. #> Merging BTGV1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes.  # Show files with raw names list.files(file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021")) #> [1] "BCGV1.rds" "BSGV1.rds" "BTGV1.rds"  # Rename files ILSArename(inputdir = file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021")) #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) found. #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) renamed.  # Show files new names  list.files(file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021")) #> [1] "REDS_2021_school.rds"  "REDS_2021_student.rds" "REDS_2021_teacher.rds"

title: Add school data — addSchools
text: Add school data student teacher files merged ILSAmerge. run combineStudents internally. see ILSA available adding school data use availableILSA.

title: Add school data — addSchools
code: addSchools(inputdir = getwd(), outputdir = getwd(), quiet = FALSE)

title: Add school data — addSchools
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSAmerge files stored. outputdir string indicating combined data saved. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE.

title: Add school data — addSchools
text: Saves combined student data teacher data added school data.

title: Add school data — addSchools
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/timssadv", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"addSchools")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"addSchools")  # Merging 'TIMSS' Advanced 1995, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = FALSE) #> 15 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging MCGM1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MCGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSAM1. Type 2 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSAM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSGM1. Type 3 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") #> [1] "MCGM1.rds" "MSAM1.rds" "MSGM1.rds"  # Add school data addSchools(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) #> 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() file(s) found. Adding schools to 1 file(s). #> Combining students for MSAM1. #> Adding schools to MSAM1, file 1 of 1. #> Adding schools took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") #> [1] "MCGM1.rds"                                  #> [2] "MSAM1.rds"                                  #> [3] "MSGM1.rds"                                  #> [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student&school.rds"

title: Check available ILSA data — availableILSA
text: Checks 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). available.

title: Check available ILSA data — availableILSA
code: availableILSA(   print = TRUE,   FOR = c("download", "combine.students", "add.schools", "ILSAready") )

title: Check available ILSA data — availableILSA
text: print logical value indicating results printed . string indicating availability ILSA data different purposes. Valid strings "download", "combine.students", add.schools, "ILSAready".

title: Check available ILSA data — availableILSA
text: list names ILSA available years.

title: Combine student data — combineStudents
text: Combines achievement background student data merged ILSAmerge. see ILSA available combining use availableILSA.

title: Combine student data — combineStudents
code: combineStudents(inputdir = getwd(), outputdir = getwd(), quiet = FALSE)

title: Combine student data — combineStudents
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSAmerge files stored. outputdir string indicating combined data saved. quiet logical value indicating progress status shown. Default FALSE.

title: Combine student data — combineStudents
text: Saves combined student data produced ILSAmerge.

title: Combine student data — combineStudents
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/timssadv", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"combineStudents")  # Merging 'TIMSS' Advanced 1995, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = FALSE) #> 15 files detected. Merging into 3 files. #> Merging MCGM1. Type 1 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MCGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSAM1. Type 2 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSAM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging MSGM1. Type 3 of 3. #> Merging dataset 1 of 5. #> Merging dataset 2 of 5. #> Merging dataset 3 of 5. #> Merging dataset 4 of 5. #> Merging dataset 5 of 5. #> Merging MSGM1 took 0 seconds or 0 minutes. #> Merging took 0 seconds or 0.01 minutes.  # Rename files ILSArename(output) #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) found. #> 3  ILSAmerge() file(s) renamed.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") #> [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              #> [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" #> [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"   # Combine student files combineStudents(inputdir = output, outputdir = output) #> 2  ILSAmerge()/ILSArename() student file(s) found. Combining into 1 file(s). #> Combining student 1 of 1. #> Combining students took 0 seconds or 0 minutes.  # Check file names list.files(output,pattern = ".rds") #> [1] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_school.rds"              #> [2] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student.rds"             #> [3] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_achievement.rds" #> [4] "TIMSSADVANCED_Math_1995_student_background.rds"

what: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: Load 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA), including: 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006) list.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: justload(   inputdir = getwd(),   population,   justattributes = FALSE,   addcountries = FALSE )

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. population character value indicating files loaded. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. justattributes logical value indicating 0 rows loaded. can used just need check column attributes. Default FALSE. addcountries logical value indicating country information added elements list. means adding variable CNTRY needed adding labels IDCNTRY needed. FALSE (default), data loaded . Country information retrieved 'GitHub' possible. , use package internal data.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: list tibbles.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Load only attributes emptylist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", justattributes = TRUE)  # Load complete data fullist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", justattributes = FALSE)  # Load complete data and add country labels withcou <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "BCGV1", addcountries = TRUE)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Produces saves 'SPSS' merge syntax given list files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: spss.syntax(filelist, name, outputdir = getwd(), zsav = TRUE, SPSSlimit = 50)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: filelist character vector list files merged. name string name merged file (without extension). outputdir directory .sps file merged file saved. zsav logical value indicating merged file compressed zsav. Default TRUE. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Saves .sps file 'SPSS' syntax merging desired files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: # Path where raw 'SPSS' files are input <- system.file("extdata/reds", package = "ILSAmerge")  # Path where merged files will be saved dir.create(file.path(tempdir(),"spsssyntax")) output <- file.path(tempdir(),"spsssyntax")  # List of BCGV1 files to be merged files <- list.files(path = input, pattern = "BCG.+V1|bcg.+v1")  # Create 'SPSS' syntax spss.syntax(filelist = files, name = "BCGV1", outputdir = output, zsav = TRUE)

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.2
text: Fixed issue saving ‘SPSS’ files. Download links PISA 2000 2018 removed.

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-26 Added ILSAready() ILSAreadylocal() wrappers downloading, merging, combining respondents, renaming.

title: ILSAmerge 1.3.0
text: unzip PISA TALIS downloads.

title: ILSAmerge 1.2.5
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-21 Added combineStudents() combining achievement background questionnaires. Added addSchools() adding school data. Added labels countries creates variables country codes country names.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.5
text: Added ILSArename() creating comprehensible file names. Fixed problem caused PIRLS 2021 empty dataset. Fixed problem merging dates TIMSS 2011. Fixed problem originated PIRLS 2001 multiple capitalization styles.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.1
text: Added extensive new documentation. Added availableILSA() check ILSA can downloaded.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-08 CRAN submission. Added PISA TALIS ILSAdownload(). ILSAdownload() connects GitHub check recent links.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.4
text: Fixed internal argument checks. Added ILSAdownload() downloading ILSA ‘SPSS’ datasets.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.1
text: Added justload() load files list merge save .

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.0
text: Initial version
